message: Most IT firms to implement return to office by end of current financial year By the end of financial year 202324 almost 80 percent of IT firms will make a fivedayaweek work from office policy mandatory which stands in contrast to what most employees want HR executives said Hybrid working may persist but remote work will mostly be off the table for most software services companies Why itu2019s important The return to office in the IT sector is much desired by corporate managers but employees are not all on board with it Forcing the move might affect staff morale

message: Aditya Gaggar Director of Progressive Shares On TCS Indian Tech giant TCS is in the secular uptrend with a higher top higher bottom formation After registering an alltime of Rs 4043 in January 2022 the stock went into a sideways correction due to the known factors but recently it has given a breakout from a Symmetrical Triangle Formation Monthly chart which was confirmed with a positive crossover in MACD and ADX while the lower time frame also boosting the confidence by giving a breakout from the Cup and Handle formation Weekly chart As per the triangle breakout the longterm target is Rs 4500 while in the short to mid term one can expect the target of Rs 4000
Post: Aditya Gaggar Director of Progressive Shares On TCS Indian Tech giant TCS is in the secular uptrend with a higher top higher bottom formation After registering an alltime of Rs 4043 in January 2022 the stock went into a sideways correction due to the known factors but recently it has given a breakout from a Symmetrical Triangle Formation Monthly chart which was confirmed with a positive crossover in MACD and ADX while the lower time frame also boosting the confidence by giving a breakout from the Cup and Handle formation Weekly chart As per the triangle breakout the longterm target is Rs 4500 while in the short to mid term one can expect the target of Rs 4000

message: Peopleu2019s Bank of China continues to own Indian shares worth Rs 25000 crore The Peopleu2019s Bank of China continues to own shares worth at least Rs 25000 crore across 20 major Indian companies including TCS Infosys Hindustan Unilever and Vedanta Infosys and ICICI Bank are the Chinese banku2019s biggest portfolio holdings in India according to regulatory filings Why itu2019s important The holdings in Indian firms by the Chinese bank is despite escalating geopolitical tensions between the two nations over a border standoff It has kept its holdings below the 1 percent threshold in companies that require public disclosure to prevent any kind of backlash
Post: Peopleu2019s Bank of China continues to own Indian shares worth Rs 25000 crore The Peopleu2019s Bank of China continues to own shares worth at least Rs 25000 crore across 20 major Indian companies including TCS Infosys Hindustan Unilever and Vedanta Infosys and ICICI Bank are the Chinese banku2019s biggest portfolio holdings in India according to regulatory filings Why itu2019s important The holdings in Indian firms by the Chinese bank is despite escalating geopolitical tensions between the two nations over a border standoff It has kept its holdings below the 1 percent threshold in companies that require public disclosure to prevent any kind of backlash

message: TCS starts earnings season on disappointing note announces Rs 17000 crore buyback IT bellwether TCS which began the earnings season for Indiau2019s 250 billion outsourcing industry reported nearly 9 percent annualised rise in net profit to Rs 11342 crore in the three months to September seasonally a strong quarter for tech firms Both net profit and revenue at Rs 59692 crore was below analystsu2019 expectations The firm also announced a share buyback of Rs 17000 crore at Rs 4150 apiece Why itu2019s important The performance of TCS acts as a proxy for the industry outlook The IT major has warned decision delays and muted client spending dented global demand and dimmed growth prospects
Post: TCS starts earnings season on disappointing note announces Rs 17000 crore buyback IT bellwether TCS which began the earnings season for Indiau2019s 250 billion outsourcing industry reported nearly 9 percent annualised rise in net profit to Rs 11342 crore in the three months to September seasonally a strong quarter for tech firms Both net profit and revenue at Rs 59692 crore was below analystsu2019 expectations The firm also announced a share buyback of Rs 17000 crore at Rs 4150 apiece Why itu2019s important The performance of TCS acts as a proxy for the industry outlook The IT major has warned decision delays and muted client spending dented global demand and dimmed growth prospects

message: The TCS second quarter numbers are unlikely to fire up the market or the IT sector Not a bad thing for those who are looking to accumulate the shares The bull argument for the IT sector is this if you stop expecting the crazy growth rates of the pandemic era and make peace with the current rate of growth then this is not a bad sector to be in Deal wins by most companies are decent if not spectacular and this is among the few sectors where valuations appear reasonable

message: Look at the movement of Persistent today and TCS today Look at the movement of Persistent and TCS over last 2 years Look at the stockprice movement of comparable American firms like Apple Microsoft Amazon Nvidia tesla etc and TCS TCS works like a govt company Compartmentalized Every HOD only looking after his domain For the stock market savviness There is no appointee Just a statement We do not interfere with stock market prices They will find their own level This is a good attitude but TCS management has interfered There is a history of interference and always to the detriment of the shareholder  Not taking any marks away here for the incredible 20 year stock price performance No market regulator can be happy at the way in which a miniscule retail portion was boughtback at 4500 This exercise saw the stock create a calculated artificial ceiling around 4k and only helped the TCS management  There is no insinuation here about the legality or the rulebook here The only discuss is the compromise of shareholder value and investor benefit here The company has bagged orders worth 20 billion in 6 months Maybe 30 billion over the whole year Who even comes close  All investors in TCS hv faced a huge opportunity loss and a 10 to 15 actual loss on their investment More painful is the loss of 700 days of non movement The companies that bag a 1 billion order see the price rise from 4k to 5k So with this kind of order bagging the price of TCS shd be blue sky because the PE ascribing will take place sooner rather than later The stock will not run but it could catch up with a 20 or 30 movement to compensate the non movement of 2 years
Post: Look at the movement of Persistent today and TCS today Look at the movement of Persistent and TCS over last 2 years Look at the stockprice movement of comparable American firms like Apple Microsoft Amazon Nvidia tesla etc and TCS TCS works like a govt company Compartmentalized Every HOD only looking after his domain For the stock market savviness There is no appointee Just a statement We do not interfere with stock market prices They will find their own level This is a good attitude but TCS management has interfered There is a history of interference and always to the detriment of the shareholder  Not taking any marks away here for the incredible 20 year stock price performance No market regulator can be happy at the way in which a miniscule retail portion was boughtback at 4500 This exercise saw the stock create a calculated artificial ceiling around 4k and only helped the TCS management  There is no insinuation here about the legality or the rulebook here The only discuss is the compromise of shareholder value and investor benefit here The company has bagged orders worth 20 billion in 6 months Maybe 30 billion over the whole year Who even comes close  All investors in TCS hv faced a huge opportunity loss and a 10 to 15 actual loss on their investment More painful is the loss of 700 days of non movement The companies that bag a 1 billion order see the price rise from 4k to 5k So with this kind of order bagging the price of TCS shd be blue sky because the PE ascribing will take place sooner rather than later The stock will not run but it could catch up with a 20 or 30 movement to compensate the non movement of 2 years

message: Tata Advance Systems bets heavily on highres satellites for military use Tata Advanced Systems has set up a factory to make highresolution imagery satellites that will help the Indian armed forces keep a closer eye on border areas The Bengalurubased facility will manufacture highresolution satellites and will have a ground station that can control their movement and process imagery required by the armed forces to monitor infrastructure or acquire military targets Why itu2019s important The Indian government has been seeking to boost domestic defense manufacturing through various policy measures Many specialist companies have responded The Tata Group seems to be betting heavily on the military space sector
Post: Tata Advance Systems bets heavily on highres satellites for military use Tata Advanced Systems has set up a factory to make highresolution imagery satellites that will help the Indian armed forces keep a closer eye on border areas The Bengalurubased facility will manufacture highresolution satellites and will have a ground station that can control their movement and process imagery required by the armed forces to monitor infrastructure or acquire military targets Why itu2019s important The Indian government has been seeking to boost domestic defense manufacturing through various policy measures Many specialist companies have responded The Tata Group seems to be betting heavily on the military space sector

message: Massive TCS share buyback likely to land parent Tata Sons Rs 12284 crore Tata Sons plans to tender 296 million shares in the Rs 17000crore buyback of flagship Tata Consultancy Services the IT service firms said in a regulatory filing If all the shares are accepted Tata Sons will mop up Rs 12284 crore which is nearly threefourths of the buyback amount Promoter holding in TCS stands at 723 percent TCS will fund the buyback through existing surplus funds and internal accruals Why itu2019s important Tata Sons has been raising funds for some of its new businesses like Tata Digital Air India and the proposed giant factory for battery cells The money raised by the buyback could be used by to fund some of these ventures
Post: Massive TCS share buyback likely to land parent Tata Sons Rs 12284 crore Tata Sons plans to tender 296 million shares in the Rs 17000crore buyback of flagship Tata Consultancy Services the IT service firms said in a regulatory filing If all the shares are accepted Tata Sons will mop up Rs 12284 crore which is nearly threefourths of the buyback amount Promoter holding in TCS stands at 723 percent TCS will fund the buyback through existing surplus funds and internal accruals Why itu2019s important Tata Sons has been raising funds for some of its new businesses like Tata Digital Air India and the proposed giant factory for battery cells The money raised by the buyback could be used by to fund some of these ventures

message: Tata Consultancy Services TCS has determined the acceptance ratio of its buyback issue at around 35 percent several investors who tendered their shares said The acceptance ratio refers to several shares accepted to be bought by the company against the number of tendered shares The ratio was 24 percent during the 2022 buyback For small shareholders the ratio of buyback ie eligible number of shares to be tendered for the number of shares held was determined at one share for every six shares held as of the record date For other shareholders it was two shares for every 209 shares held by them The company planned to repurchase 409 crore shares at Rs 4150 apiece and received bids for 26 crore shares
Post: Tata Consultancy Services TCS has determined the acceptance ratio of its buyback issue at around 35 percent several investors who tendered their shares said The acceptance ratio refers to several shares accepted to be bought by the company against the number of tendered shares The ratio was 24 percent during the 2022 buyback For small shareholders the ratio of buyback ie eligible number of shares to be tendered for the number of shares held was determined at one share for every six shares held as of the record date For other shareholders it was two shares for every 209 shares held by them The company planned to repurchase 409 crore shares at Rs 4150 apiece and received bids for 26 crore shares

message: Indian equities slide with global peers dragged down by IT and metal stocks Indiau2019s benchmark indices fell dragged down by IT and metal stocks as global markets slid amid fading optimism about early interest rate cuts in the US The Sensex shed 075 percent to 7135660 points and the Nifty50 fell 069 percent to 2151735 Information technology the secondheaviest sectoral index fell 252 percent its largest intraday drop since July 21 Why itu2019s important Markets are getting a reality check after the sharp rally in the past two months Much depends on the upcoming results season and there could be further selling pressure till then
Post: Indian equities slide with global peers dragged down by IT and metal stocks Indiau2019s benchmark indices fell dragged down by IT and metal stocks as global markets slid amid fading optimism about early interest rate cuts in the US The Sensex shed 075 percent to 7135660 points and the Nifty50 fell 069 percent to 2151735 Information technology the secondheaviest sectoral index fell 252 percent its largest intraday drop since July 21 Why itu2019s important Markets are getting a reality check after the sharp rally in the past two months Much depends on the upcoming results season and there could be further selling pressure till then

message: Key highlights of TCS Q3 result IT service provider Tata Consultancy Services TCS reported net profit of u20B911058 crore for the December quarter down 25 compared to previous quarter During the same period consolidated revenue rose 14 QoQ to u20B960583 crore The companyu2019s revenue was inline with estimates However the net profit was below the market estimate of u20B911498 crore Along with the result the TCS board also approved a dividend of u20B927 per share including a special dividend of u20B918 per share Record date 19 January Payment date 05 February TCS reported deal total contract value TCV of 81 billion down from 112 billion in the previous quarter As of 31 December the TCS workforce stood at 603305 Headcount was down by 5680 in Q3 During the last twelve months the attrition rate was at 133

message: Indiau2019s largest IT services company Tata Consultancy Services TCS on January 11 reported that its deal total contract value TCV for the third quarter ended December 31 came in at 81 billion missing the companyu2019s quarterly deal win guidance of 910 billion This was largely driven by the company not winning any mega deals this quarter apart from a decline in key verticals like banking financial services and insurance BFSI and the overall market sentiment not changing despite cuts in the Fedu2019s interest rate cuts Also Q3 is a seasonally weak quarter for the IT sector TCV declined from 112 billion reported in Q2
Post: Indiau2019s largest IT services company Tata Consultancy Services TCS on January 11 reported that its deal total contract value TCV for the third quarter ended December 31 came in at 81 billion missing the companyu2019s quarterly deal win guidance of 910 billion This was largely driven by the company not winning any mega deals this quarter apart from a decline in key verticals like banking financial services and insurance BFSI and the overall market sentiment not changing despite cuts in the Fedu2019s interest rate cuts Also Q3 is a seasonally weak quarter for the IT sector TCV declined from 112 billion reported in Q2

message: TCS and Infosys post muted third quarter results on weakness in key markets Tata Consultancy Services grew marginally faster than its closest rival Infosys in the December quarter even as both IT heavyweights remained at risk of post weak growth numbers in 202324 Infosys has cut its revenue growth guidance for the third consecutive quarter TCS beat analyst expectations slightly but still saw muted growth Why itu2019s important Indiau2019s top two software companies have sent out a clear signal that the macro environment remains tough and their clients in key Western markets are spending cautiously

message: Equity valuation of top IT companies widens sharply with actual financial performance The gap between equity valuation of top IT firms and their actual financial performance is rising rapidly The nifty IT index has surged 71 percent in the past two trading sessions at a time when Indiau2019s four largest IT companies reported their worst quarterly performance in over five years The top four IT firms are now trading at a trailing price to earnings multiple of 291 times the highest in the past seven quarters Why itu2019s important There seems to be no fundamental basis for the rally in IT stocks other than expectations that earnings growth will improve Speculative exuberance seems to be the order of the day

message: Macro headwinds slow down deal wins for Indiau2019s top software services firms The top four IT companies in India saw a sequential decline in their total contract value in the December quarter as macroheadwinds persisted for the sector The value for TCS for instance fell from 112 billion in the second quarter to 81 billion in the three months ended December HCLu2019s new deal wins for the quarter stood at 1927 billion down from 3969 billion The trend held for the other two firms as well Why itu2019s important The momentum in the IT services sectoru2019s deal wins which was resilient even amid the slowdown in key Western markets has now moderated considerably The outlook remains dim

message: Tata Consultancy bags biggest 15year outsourcing deal worth 25 billion Tata Consultancy has won a 15year outsourcing deal with British insurer Aviva valued at least 25 billion possibly its largest outsourcing deal The companyu2019s biggest deal before this was a 225 billion contract signed with Nielsen in December 2017 The deal renews its current engagement till 2039 under which Friends Life had initially awarded a 22 billion to the company in 2012 Aviva acquired Friends Life in 2014 Why itu2019s important This is the third mega deal of contracts worth over 1 billion that TCS has under K Krithivasan who took over as chief executive last June after the abrupt departure of Rajesh Gopinathan in March Mega deals nowadays play a central role in Indiau2019s large tech firms
Post: Tata Consultancy bags biggest 15year outsourcing deal worth 25 billion Tata Consultancy has won a 15year outsourcing deal with British insurer Aviva valued at least 25 billion possibly its largest outsourcing deal The companyu2019s biggest deal before this was a 225 billion contract signed with Nielsen in December 2017 The deal renews its current engagement till 2039 under which Friends Life had initially awarded a 22 billion to the company in 2012 Aviva acquired Friends Life in 2014 Why itu2019s important This is the third mega deal of contracts worth over 1 billion that TCS has under K Krithivasan who took over as chief executive last June after the abrupt departure of Rajesh Gopinathan in March Mega deals nowadays play a central role in Indiau2019s large tech firms

message: Tata Consultancy plans doubledigit blitz after growing at a slow pace in 202324 Tata Consultancy Services CEO K Krithivasan and Tata Sons chairman N Chandrasekaran huddled with the companyu2019s top 800 executives in Abu Dhabi to sketch a rebound plan for Indiau2019s top IT services firm that will grow at a slow pace in the year to March 31 the Mint reported At the annual strategic retreat called Blitz Krithivasan wanted TCS to clock doubledigit revenue growth in 202425 which means over 10 percent growth double the 52 percent dollar growth expected in 202324
Post: Tata Consultancy plans doubledigit blitz after growing at a slow pace in 202324 Tata Consultancy Services CEO K Krithivasan and Tata Sons chairman N Chandrasekaran huddled with the companyu2019s top 800 executives in Abu Dhabi to sketch a rebound plan for Indiau2019s top IT services firm that will grow at a slow pace in the year to March 31 the Mint reported At the annual strategic retreat called Blitz Krithivasan wanted TCS to clock doubledigit revenue growth in 202425 which means over 10 percent growth double the 52 percent dollar growth expected in 202324

message: TCS may offer 78 percent pay hike to offsite staff as attrition normalizes in bellwether firm Tata Consultancy Services is planning to increase salaries by an average of 78 percent for its offsite employees and 24 percent for its onsite personnel in 202425 the Business Standard reported High performers can expect a raise of 1215 percent The company which had a headcount of 603305 will be also looking at the promotions and the process may get pushed to the first quarter of 202425 Why itu2019s important Salary hikes in Indiau2019s largest IT services firm often indicate the state of pay in the entire sector The moderate raises come in the backdrop of stabilizing attrition and a muted business outlook in key western markets
Post: TCS may offer 78 percent pay hike to offsite staff as attrition normalizes in bellwether firm Tata Consultancy Services is planning to increase salaries by an average of 78 percent for its offsite employees and 24 percent for its onsite personnel in 202425 the Business Standard reported High performers can expect a raise of 1215 percent The company which had a headcount of 603305 will be also looking at the promotions and the process may get pushed to the first quarter of 202425 Why itu2019s important Salary hikes in Indiau2019s largest IT services firm often indicate the state of pay in the entire sector The moderate raises come in the backdrop of stabilizing attrition and a muted business outlook in key western markets

message: The countrys largest IT services company has recorded 91 percent onyear growth in net profit at Rs 12434 crore for the quarter ended March FY24 beating analysts estimates Revenue from operations grew by 35 percent YoY to Rs 61237 crore driven by India the UK and the manufacturing segment while the constant currency revenue growth was 22 percent EBIT for the quarter grew by 10 percent to Rs 15918 crore with a margin expansion of 150 bps at 26 percent compared to the yearago period TCS reported a record total contract value of 132 billion during the quarter while the fullyear order book stood at an alltime high of 427 billion The company announced a dividend of Rs 28 per share for the financial year 2023u201324

message: Tata Sonsu2019 board may induct new faces as two directors near end of term The board of Tata Sons is set for a refresh in the next 15 months as two directors retire to make way for new members the Mint reported Bhaskar Bhat and Ralf Speth who joined the board in 2017 and 2016 respectively will reach Tata Sonsu2019 mandatory retirement age of 70 over this year and next Last month Tata Sonsu2019 10member board chaired by Natarajan Chandrasekaran gave a third threeyear term to independent director Harish Manwani a former chief operating officer of Unilever Plc Why itu2019s important The development will take place at a time when the holding company of the Tata Group is aiming to become free of debt and avoid a public listing
Post: Tata Sonsu2019 board may induct new faces as two directors near end of term The board of Tata Sons is set for a refresh in the next 15 months as two directors retire to make way for new members the Mint reported Bhaskar Bhat and Ralf Speth who joined the board in 2017 and 2016 respectively will reach Tata Sonsu2019 mandatory retirement age of 70 over this year and next Last month Tata Sonsu2019 10member board chaired by Natarajan Chandrasekaran gave a third threeyear term to independent director Harish Manwani a former chief operating officer of Unilever Plc Why itu2019s important The development will take place at a time when the holding company of the Tata Group is aiming to become free of debt and avoid a public listing

message: TCS inks multiyear partnership with AWS Tata Consultancy Services TCS on April 24 announced that it has entered into a multiyear strategic partnership with Amazon Web Services AWS to offer cloud transformation and generative AI solutions to customers This new transformation agreement with AWS will enable TCS to facilitate fullstack digital transformation of its customers by leveraging data and generative artificial intelligence AI solutions on AWS the company said As part of the deal AWS will support in upskilling and reskilling of 25000 TCS employees with the latest cloud and GenAI skills
Post: TCS inks multiyear partnership with AWS Tata Consultancy Services TCS on April 24 announced that it has entered into a multiyear strategic partnership with Amazon Web Services AWS to offer cloud transformation and generative AI solutions to customers This new transformation agreement with AWS will enable TCS to facilitate fullstack digital transformation of its customers by leveraging data and generative artificial intelligence AI solutions on AWS the company said As part of the deal AWS will support in upskilling and reskilling of 25000 TCS employees with the latest cloud and GenAI skills

message: Buoyant markets see promoters of Indian firms trim share pledges to lower debt Promoters of Indian companies including Adani Power Tata Consultancy Services and Tata Motors reduced their aggregate share pledges by Rs 56448 crore 68 billion in the year ended March the Mint reported In 202324 52 companies saw a 35 percent decrease or Rs 82576 crore in the value of their pledged shares according to an analysis on regulatory filings of Nifty 500 companies which account for 91 percent of the market value Why itu2019s important The promoters have taken advantage of buoyant stock markets to lower their debt positions Companies that significantly reduced their pledge values also tended to deliver positive returns at the stock market
Post: Buoyant markets see promoters of Indian firms trim share pledges to lower debt Promoters of Indian companies including Adani Power Tata Consultancy Services and Tata Motors reduced their aggregate share pledges by Rs 56448 crore 68 billion in the year ended March the Mint reported In 202324 52 companies saw a 35 percent decrease or Rs 82576 crore in the value of their pledged shares according to an analysis on regulatory filings of Nifty 500 companies which account for 91 percent of the market value Why itu2019s important The promoters have taken advantage of buoyant stock markets to lower their debt positions Companies that significantly reduced their pledge values also tended to deliver positive returns at the stock market

message: Average age of personnel at TCS and Infosys rises beyond 30 years in past two years Tata Consultancy Services and Infosys Indiau2019s top two IT services firms have seen a decline in staff aged 30 years or less over the past two years the Mint reported Their share in TCSu2019s workforce has fallen from 59 percent in 202122 to 503 percent in 202324 For Infosys the drop was to 55 percent from 60 precent Once business expansion revives the younger employee headcount might pick up Why itu2019s important The decline is more due to lower fresher hiring and weak growth of IT services companies in 202324 and not to the advance of artificial intelligence or generative AI taking over entrylevel jobs That could come later
Post: Average age of personnel at TCS and Infosys rises beyond 30 years in past two years Tata Consultancy Services and Infosys Indiau2019s top two IT services firms have seen a decline in staff aged 30 years or less over the past two years the Mint reported Their share in TCSu2019s workforce has fallen from 59 percent in 202122 to 503 percent in 202324 For Infosys the drop was to 55 percent from 60 precent Once business expansion revives the younger employee headcount might pick up Why itu2019s important The decline is more due to lower fresher hiring and weak growth of IT services companies in 202324 and not to the advance of artificial intelligence or generative AI taking over entrylevel jobs That could come later

message: US Court imposes USD 194 mn penalty on TCS for trade secret misappropriation The Company has received an adverse judgement passed by United States District Court Northern District of Texas Dallas Division The Court ordered that the company is liable to Computer Sciences Corporation CSC DXC Technology Company DXC for USD 56151583 in compensatory damages and USD 112303166 in exemplary damages The Court also assessed that the company is liable for USD 2577357660 in prejudgment interest through June 13 2024 The Court also passed certain injunctions and other reliefs against the Company The company believes that it has strong arguments in the matter and intend to defend its position through review petitionappeal to the appropriate Court and has no major adverse impact on its financials and operations
Post: US Court imposes USD 194 mn penalty on TCS for trade secret misappropriation The Company has received an adverse judgement passed by United States District Court Northern District of Texas Dallas Division The Court ordered that the company is liable to Computer Sciences Corporation CSC DXC Technology Company DXC for USD 56151583 in compensatory damages and USD 112303166 in exemplary damages The Court also assessed that the company is liable for USD 2577357660 in prejudgment interest through June 13 2024 The Court also passed certain injunctions and other reliefs against the Company The company believes that it has strong arguments in the matter and intend to defend its position through review petitionappeal to the appropriate Court and has no major adverse impact on its financials and operations

message:
Tata Group likely to establish first overseas defence manufacturing plant in Morocco Report

Tata Advanced Systems Ltd TASL is setting up its first major defence manufacturing facility abroad according to a report by The Economic Times The plant located in Casablanca Morocco will initially focus on producing Wheeled Armoured Platforms WhAP for the Royal Moroccan Armed Forces with ambitions to serve the broader African market in the long term

The WhAP is an amphibious infantry combat vehicle designed to navigate various terrains and has already been deployed in limited numbers by the Indian Army including at the Ladakh border The new factory is expected to have an annual production capacity of 100 combat vehicles and is projected to be operational within a year with the first units slated for rollout within 18 months the ET report added
Post:
Tata Group likely to establish first overseas defence manufacturing plant in Morocco Report

Tata Advanced Systems Ltd TASL is setting up its first major defence manufacturing facility abroad according to a report by The Economic Times The plant located in Casablanca Morocco will initially focus on producing Wheeled Armoured Platforms WhAP for the Royal Moroccan Armed Forces with ambitions to serve the broader African market in the long term

The WhAP is an amphibious infantry combat vehicle designed to navigate various terrains and has already been deployed in limited numbers by the Indian Army including at the Ladakh border The new factory is expected to have an annual production capacity of 100 combat vehicles and is projected to be operational within a year with the first units slated for rollout within 18 months the ET report added

Partial operations resume at Apple contractor Tata Electronics Tamil Nadu facility

Tata Electronics a key maker of Apples iPhone components has resumed operations in several areas of its fireaffected Hosur factory in Tamil Nadu the Hindu Businessline reported The company said its employees will continue receiving full pay as they resume work in its facility

message:
Trent Tata Chemicals Tata Investment Corp rise over 3prcnt on Noel Tatas appointment as new Tata Trusts chairman

Noel is on the boards of several listed Tata firms including Tata Steel Ltd and Voltas Ltd

Since 2014 Noel Tata has served as the chairman of Trent Ltd the Tata Groups highly successful apparel retail business
Post:
Trent Tata Chemicals Tata Investment Corp rise over 3prcnt on Noel Tatas appointment as new Tata Trusts chairman

Noel is on the boards of several listed Tata firms including Tata Steel Ltd and Voltas Ltd

Since 2014 Noel Tata has served as the chairman of Trent Ltd the Tata Groups highly successful apparel retail business

message:
Noel Naval Tata said he is deeply honoured and humbled after being appointed unanimously as the chairman of Tata Trusts The decision was taken after the trustees of various Trusts that comprise the Tata Trusts met at a joint meeting held in Mumbai today

Speaking on this occasion Noel Tata Chairman Tata Trusts stated  I look forward to carrying on the legacy of Mr Ratan N Tata and the Founders of the Tata Group On this solemn occasion we rededicate ourselves to carrying on our developmental and philanthropic initiatives and continuing to play our part in nation building

Son of Naval H Tata and Simone N Tata Noel who he has largely focused on Tata groups global retail operations was already a trustee of the Sir Ratan Tata Trust and the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust which together own 66 percent of Tata Sons the holding company of the diversified group

Noel known to keep away from limelight has been serving as Trent Ltds chairman since 2014
Post:
Noel Naval Tata said he is deeply honoured and humbled after being appointed unanimously as the chairman of Tata Trusts The decision was taken after the trustees of various Trusts that comprise the Tata Trusts met at a joint meeting held in Mumbai today

Speaking on this occasion Noel Tata Chairman Tata Trusts stated  I look forward to carrying on the legacy of Mr Ratan N Tata and the Founders of the Tata Group On this solemn occasion we rededicate ourselves to carrying on our developmental and philanthropic initiatives and continuing to play our part in nation building

Son of Naval H Tata and Simone N Tata Noel who he has largely focused on Tata groups global retail operations was already a trustee of the Sir Ratan Tata Trust and the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust which together own 66 percent of Tata Sons the holding company of the diversified group

Noel known to keep away from limelight has been serving as Trent Ltds chairman since 2014

message:
With Noel Tata in charge Tata Group may reconcile differences with Shapoorji Pallonji  

Seven years after a bitter corporate battle the Shapoorji Pallonji and Tata groups could be making efforts to reconcile as Noel Tata takes charge of the Tata Trusts the Hindu Businessline reported Noel Tata is married to Aloo Mistry daughter of the late Pallonji Shapoorji Mistry He is known for his nonconfrontational leadership style and could be a potential mediator  

Why its important For Shapoorji Pallonji a reconciliation with the Tata Group would ease financial challenges But the future of its stake in Tata Sons valued at over Rs 3 lakh crore could be a sticking point

message:
Tata Trusts against Shapoorji Pallonji Group taking fresh loans against Tata Sons shares

Tata Sons shares cannot be used as collateral for fresh loans by the Shapoorji Pallonji Group Siddharth Sharma chief executive of Tata Trusts told Mint The group plans to use the 184 percent shares it owns in Tata Sons as collateral to replace its loans totalling Rs 22000 crore dolr26 billion payable by March The shares are already pledged against these loans and the aim is to transfer the shares to a new set of investors to raise money to repay the earlier loan

Why its important The friction between the Shapoorji Pallonji Group the largest public shareholder of Tata Sons and the philanthropic entities that control the Tata empire remains despite a change of guard at the Tata Trusts with Noel Tata taking over as chairman This would need to be resolved soon

message:
TCS Q3 net profit rises 12prcnt to Rs 12380 crore declares Rs 66 special dividend

IT major Tata Consultancy Services Ltd on January 9 reported consolidated net profit of Rs 12380 crore in the quarter ended December 31 2024 a rise of 12prcnt when compared to Rs 11058 crore in the yearago period thus beating estimates marginally

The companys consolidated revenue from operations rose 6prcnt to Rs 63973 crore in Q3FY25 from Rs 60583 crore in Q3FY24 thus missing estimates On a sequential basis the IT majors net profit rose 4prcnt

The company declared a third interim dividend of Rs 10 and a special dividend of Rs 66 per equity share of Re 1 each of the company The record date for the dividend is January 17 and payment date is February 3 said TCS in a stock exchange filing
Post:
TCS Q3 net profit rises 12prcnt to Rs 12380 crore declares Rs 66 special dividend

IT major Tata Consultancy Services Ltd on January 9 reported consolidated net profit of Rs 12380 crore in the quarter ended December 31 2024 a rise of 12prcnt when compared to Rs 11058 crore in the yearago period thus beating estimates marginally

The companys consolidated revenue from operations rose 6prcnt to Rs 63973 crore in Q3FY25 from Rs 60583 crore in Q3FY24 thus missing estimates On a sequential basis the IT majors net profit rose 4prcnt

The company declared a third interim dividend of Rs 10 and a special dividend of Rs 66 per equity share of Re 1 each of the company The record date for the dividend is January 17 and payment date is February 3 said TCS in a stock exchange filing

message:
TCS Q3 order book grows 26prcnt YoY to dolr102 billion highest in past five fiscal years

Indias largest IT services company Tata Consultancy Services TCS reported its highest third quarter order book in at least the past five fiscal years with total contract value TCV at dolr102 billion in the period ended December 31

This comes in a seasonally weak quarter for the IT industry due to holiday season in core markets like North America

The TCV for the quarter was 2593 percent higher from the dolr81 billion in the yearago period and was up 186 percent from the previous quarter the company said on January 9

From Q3 TCS deal wins include a 15year endtoend digital solution deal with Irelands Department of Social Protection a multiyear AIready cloud native data landscape deal with Air FranceKLM a transformation deal with Bank of Bhutan a fiveyear deal extension with Denmarks Telenor and a threeyear hardware and software deal for the Indian governments SPARSH System for Pension Administration Raksha to name a few
Post:

Indias largest IT services company Tata Consultancy Services TCS reported its highest third quarter order book in at least the past five fiscal years with total contract value TCV at dolr102 billion in the period ended December 31

This comes in a seasonally weak quarter for the IT industry due to holiday season in core markets like North America

The TCV for the quarter was 2593 percent higher from the dolr81 billion in the yearago period and was up 186 percent from the previous quarter the company said on January 9

From Q3 TCS deal wins include a 15year endtoend digital solution deal with Irelands Department of Social Protection a multiyear AIready cloud native data landscape deal with Air FranceKLM a transformation deal with Bank of Bhutan a fiveyear deal extension with Denmarks Telenor and a threeyear hardware and software deal for the Indian governments SPARSH System for Pension Administration Raksha to name a few
